channel.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
channel.description:
i just surfed around the web and found this on moddb [quote] this news comes a little late, but for those unaware due to the recent release of a free Team Fortress 2, the Source SDK will soon become free to use in its entirety, for everyone (confirmed by Valve's Robin Walker in this RockPaperShotgun article). The free SDK was first uncovered in our forums on the 28th of June by an enterprising young man going by the name of Riley, who just happens to be the playtest leader of esteemed Source mods Zombie Panic Source and No More Room In Hell.
This means that all Source mods, made for Valve games (we list around 1,500 for HL2 alone) may eventually be free to play, without requiring you to purchase a Valve game (thou who hasn't purchased a valve game on this site?) [/quote] source: [url='https://www.moddb.com/engines/source/news/source-sdk-is-free']moddb[/url]
so does this mean that everyone can play black mesa?

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
If you can get the Source SDK Base, you can play BM.
If you can get the Source SDK/Swarn SDK and know how to make a custom game configuration, you can map for BM.

You should be able to do both with just TF2.

Read full topic
item.source: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: Int3
item.description:
Yes, but I would like to know how the case is, if you don’t have HL2 on your account. If you only have L4D or no purchased game on your account.

I am just thinking about other people who don’t have HL2 and who would like to know the exact requirements, so that they can decide, which game they buy for making playing and mapping for Black Mesa possible…

Read full topic
item.source: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
if you own HL2 then you can already make maps in hammer for BM

even if you only have access to the tf2 mapping tools, when you import Black Mesa’s .fgd file into hammer it should be totally set up to make BM maps.

Read full topic
item.source: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: Int3
item.description:
Thanks, but I already read this page.

The thing is, that it wasn’t officially tested by a Black Mesa developer.

Also there is still the question, if you can create maps for Black Mesa, if you only have Portal 2 or Left 4 Dead or no game in your account, beause you are limited to the MP engine branch and only can select TF2 in these cases.

Medevilae:

Hope you enjoy the mod and decide to pick up Half-Life 2, it’s a great game in its own right

Thanks, but I already got a “legal” version of the game. That was simply not my point…

Read full topic
item.source: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Int3:

Would a pirate ask for a legal way for playing a mod for free, if you could just load an illegal version of a game, which offers mod support or a modified version of the mod later?

By the way: I don’t think I need to justify myself, just because I want information about the requirements.

https://www.wiki.blackmesasource.com/System_Requirements

Hope you enjoy the mod and decide to pick up Half-Life 2, it’s a great game in its own right

Read full topic

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Int3:

Maybe I already got a few Source games, but just wanna know the ‘exact’ system requirements?

Maybe I want to play with a friend in multi player who doesn’t wanna buy a source game (if not necessary)?

Maybe I am just interested in playing a great mod, but don’t wanna buy a game I am not interested in just for being able to play the mod (if not necessary)?

or…

Read full topic
item.source: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: Int3
item.description:
Gregorovich!:

I don’t see why it’s up to the developers to do these things. If you want to play Black Mesa, just buy a source game. I don’t see how you’d even have heard of BM without owning any Valve titles.

Maybe I already got a few Source games, but just wanna know the ‘exact’ system requirements?

Maybe I want to play with a friend in multi player who doesn’t wanna buy a source game (if not necessary)?

Maybe I am just interested in playing a great mod, but don’t wanna buy a game I am not interested in just for being able to play the mod (if not necessary)?

And it is usual that a developer provides the correct system requirements for his own product.

Read full topic
item.source: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: Gregorovich
item.description:
Int3:

Sry for bumping this up but in my opinion there are still open questions that need to be clarified!

  1. Does Black Mesa really work by only having Source SDK Base 2007 (+ 2006) installed?

  2. Will you be able to set up the Source SDK/Hammer editor to create custom maps for Black Mesa, if you only have a blank account without any purchased game (in this case the SDK only lets you choose the engine branch “Source Engine MP” with “Team Fortress 2”) or if you only have purchased a game like Portal 2 or L4D (because they don’t give you acccess to anything in the default sdk, but come with their own authoring tools).

A Black Mesa developer should create a blank account and test these cases to provide for all contingencies.

I don’t see why it’s up to the developers to do these things. If you want to play Black Mesa, just buy a source game. I don’t see how you’d even have heard of BM without owning any Valve titles.

Read full topic

A Black Mesa developer should create a blank account and test these cases to provide for all contingencies.

item.description:
Fnork:

Why would anyone interested in this mod not have played HL2, is the question I’m asking.

I’ve played every HL game, and I would still be interested in this mod even if I hadn’t played HL2, really if you play any HL game, even the expansions, I don’t see why this mod wouldn’t be interesting.

item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
main site:

As long as you have a copy of any source engine game on steam, Black Mesa will cost you nothing.

I don’t see how that statement is incorrect.

You can go make a blank account and there you go a copy of a source engine game (TF2) on Steam.

item.dc:creator: Nynx
item.description:
striker:

He was probably specifically referring to the main page.

Exactly.

By the way my English isn’t very well, why I should leave writing wiki entries to someone else.

Gregorovich!:

I don’t see the problem. Just buy HL2. It’s an awesome game (except those massive boring vehicle bits).

I already have bought HL2. But this doesn’t have anything to do with the fact that the system requirements page should provide correct information!

Fnork:

Why would anyone interested in this mod not have played HL2, is the question I’m asking.

As I alreay said, this is not a question of why would anyone be interested in this mod, it is a matter of having correct information on the system requirements page!

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Nynx:

I’ve created a new account without any purchased game and I have full access to the Source SDK Base and Source SDK 2007!

So, why aren’t you updating the outdated information on the system requirements page already?

do you mean the page in the wiki which can be edited by the community?

Read full topic
item.source: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?

item.title: source sdk free means all can play black mesa?
item.dc:creator: Nynx
item.description:
Jack Freeman:

They got other more important stuff to do.

Maybe it isn’t that important, but users can be confused by that wrong information! And as Triver already said, it would only require a few minutes to update that page!

Mephmage:

Because as is, it encourages people who doesn’t have a source-game, to purchase one. Which I believe is a nice gesture towards valve. But perhaps that’s just me.

I’ve nothing against supporting Valve by purchasing any of their great games, but not by giving users wrong information!
In the end it was Valve’s own decision to make the Source SDK free to anyone, which makes it legal and possible to play mods without a purchased Source game.

Read full topic
